DOC.criteria: Age 18 60 year . First focal clinical episode suggestive demyelinating disease within previous 180 day ( measured onset first symptom treatment start ) , base appearance neurological abnormality , present least 24 hour . Objective clinical evidence must present document . Patients include irrespective whether first clinical demyelinating episode monosymptomatic ( i.e . clinical evidence single lesion ) polysymptomatic ( i.e . clinical evidence one lesion ) . At least two lesion T2weighted brain MRI* scan least one ovoid periventricular infratentorial . MRI eligibility determine centrally UBC MS/MRI Research Group . *One lesion spinal MRI may substitute one brain lesion per 2005 McDonald Criteria . Sexually active woman childbearing potential must agree use adequate contraception . Written informed consent Any disease MS could better explain patient 's sign symptom . Any previous clinical event reasonably attributable acute demyelination , regardless whether medical attention obtain . Complete transverse myelitis bilateral optic neuritis . A waiver obtain bilateral optic neuritis must obtain prior randomization . Waivers must approve 3 neurologist include member Clinical Eligibility / Endpoint Committee , member DSMC , experience MS neurophthalmologist .
